channel.title: Stuff.co.nz - Stuff
channel.description: Top Stories from Stuff.co.nz. New Zealand, world, sport, business & entertainment news on Stuff.co.nz.

item.title: Covid-19 live: Auckland to move to alert level 3, rest of country stays in level 2
item.description: The city will move down alert level at 11.59pm on Tuesday for at least two weeks, while the rest of NZ stays in level 2. Experts say the move is a "calculated risk", warning of the possibility of going back to level 4 if cases flare up.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Covid-19: What you need to know about Auckland moving to alert level 3
item.description: Masks in high schools and a stay-at-home plea for over 65s who aren’t vaccinated are all part of a new-look alert level 3 for Auckland.
item.dc:creator: ADAM JACOBSON

item.title: Covid-19: What travel is allowed at alert level 3?
item.description: Aucklanders are allowed limited travel within their region — here's what's permitted.
item.dc:creator: BROOK SABIN

item.title: Covid-19 NZ: Auckland will move to alert level 3 at 11.59pm Tuesday for at least two weeks
item.description: Jacinda Ardern says "long hard tail" of Delta has been tough, but level 3 will be able to contain it.
item.dc:creator: HENRY COOKE

item.title: Police search for man with multiple warrants for arrest
item.description: Police are seeking information as to the whereabouts of Adrian Colbert, who has previously been linked to a racket involving expensive cars.
item.dc:creator: HANNA MCCALLUM

item.title: Covid-19: New gathering limit under 'Delta level 2' a mixed bag for businesses
item.description: The increase in social gatherings to 100 indoors is little benefit to businesses who want the South Island to move to alert level 1.
item.dc:creator: NADINE PORTER

item.title: The Morning Show: Apple's star-studded #MeToo newsroom drama is back with a bang
item.description: REVIEW: Featuring a never-better Jennifer Aniston and a magnificent Reese Witherspoon, the impressive ensemble adds Juliana Margulies for Season 2.
item.dc:creator: JAMES CROOT

item.title: Police arrest man after person struck by car in Bay of Plenty
item.description: A 21-year-old man has been arrested after a person was struck by a car in the Bay of Plenty.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Covid-19: Bespoke level 4 'not ideal' but rural Waikato communities getting on with it
item.description: Small communities affected by temporary alert level setting gutted by the move after thinking they were "going the other way [level 1], and now it has got worse”.
item.dc:creator: SHARNAE HOPE

item.title: Neon's Scenes From a Marriage, Netflix's Sex Education among great shows to stream
item.description: A controversial '70s Swedish series gets a modern makeover and a popular British dramedy is back for a third season.
item.dc:creator: JAMES CROOT

item.title: Covid-positive prisoner made four stops on way to bail address, Corrections says
item.description: After being released from prison, the man went to houses in Mt Albert and Māngere, then a Pokeno supermarket, before stopping on a Kaiaua road.
item.dc:creator: GEORGE BLOCK

item.title: The council, the killer worm, and the legal stoush
item.description: A council wanted a developer to instal fences, stop clearing vegetation, and create special sanctuaries for killer worms. It did not end well.
item.dc:creator: HAMISH MCNEILLY

item.title: Alert level changes bring little relief to Southland
item.description: A Te Anau restaurant owner has gone from serving more than 200 diners a day, to making just $1000 a week. The increased cap on gatherings will have little impact on his business, he says.
item.dc:creator: LOUISA STEYL

item.title: Auckland fire crews to stay on site overnight after blaze at Mt Wellington warehouse
item.description: A worker at a nearby office saw "heaps of smoke" and noticed “a very strong smell of burning plastic” coming from the building.
item.dc:creator: LUCY XIA AND MINA KERR-LAZENBY

item.title: Council seeks clarity over Government plans to manage three waters debt
item.description: The Government’s three waters reform has hit a snag that could cost Christchurch ratepayers millions of dollars, a city councillor says.
item.dc:creator: TINA LAW

item.title: Silver Ferns v England live - first test, Taini Jamison Trophy
item.description: England are contesting everything against the new-look Silver Ferns, who have a narrow lead going into the final quarter.
item.dc:creator: IAN ANDERSON

item.title: Covid-19: Man charged over travel from Auckland to Wellington in lockdown denied bail
item.description: A man and woman charged over an alleged lockdown breach have been granted name suppression – but one has lost their freedom.
item.dc:creator: WELLINGTON DISTRICT COURTS REPORTER

item.title: Tall tales and spectacular stories find new home with opening of children's bookshop
item.description: Owners of Scorpio Books have opened Telling Tales, a new children's bookshop located in central Christchurch.
item.dc:creator: HANNA MCCALLUM

item.title: Covid-19: 90 per cent or higher vaccination coverage will bring fewer restrictions, Jacinda Ardern says
item.description: The Government will share what modelling says about vaccination rates and restrictions this week.
item.dc:creator: BRIDIE WITTON

item.title: Covid-19: Waikato DHB taking 'cautious approach' restricting visitors and services
item.description: Waikato DHB chief executive Dr Kevin Snee said a “cautious approach” was being taken until community transmission of Covid-19 had been ruled out.
item.dc:creator: Stuff
